jobs.title: Architect Specialist Junior
jobs.description:
**Your role**

We’re looking for a versatile Architect Junior to join our team. Someone who can quickly take ownership across a variety of roles, from analysing project documentation, project managing the delivery and quality across customer accounts, to supporting the design of our product and processes. If you’re eager to learn, and aren’t afraid to dive straight into new challenges, this is a unique opportunity to be part of creating the way buildings will be designed, built and operated in the future.

The job of an architect at Disperse isn’t like your typical architect gig. We harness the characteristics that come naturally to engineers: creative problem-solvers, being bottomless idea wells, superhuman work ethics, and the ability to adapt on the fly - and unleash these across the business. You’ll find yourself as part-construction and architecture specialist, part-digital product designer, part-business strategist, as well as the voice of the industry.

Your main responsibility will be to ensure that we onboard new projects, project manage their delivery and deliver value to our customers from day one. It’ll be your job to create the connection between our customer's project plans, the construction site and our product. You’ll be working in our project team, as well closely with our customers, product and computer vision teams. You’ll be experiencing first-hand what it takes to scale up a tech startup and will get the opportunity to work on some of the most prestigious projects in the world, starting from UK and US market.

NOTE: This role is available in Sarajevo and Mostar (Bosnia and Herzegovina). Strictly non-remote.

Desired start date as soon as possible.

**Our culture**

Ask anyone at Disperse what they love most about working here, and they'll probably tell you "it's the people!", "the team, of course", "the people and the Hedwig owls in the offices".

As clichéd as it may sound, we're very proud of the people we have and the close-knit, family culture we've built across London, Sarajevo, Mostar and Yerevan. Despite the distances, we're united through the passion with which we approach our goals and the fun that we have along the way. The following should give you a good idea what type of culture you'd be joining:

- We encourage proactivity and taking full ownership of problems and initiatives. We don't believe in micromanagement. Instead, we let you pave your own path and give you the space to continuously learn and grow even if it means taking a few detours.
- We support each other. If a process breaks or if you're struggling, you can always count on the people around you and the people far away from you, to help you get back on track.
- We run on feedback: direct and transparent praise and constructive criticism, communicated with the best of intentions. There is no other way to learn!
- Ideas and approaches are always judged on merit rather than source. We welcome discussions and challenges. This way everyone makes a tremendous impact no matter the role.

**Requirements**

You should apply if:

- You are ambitious and passionate about creating something meaningful
- You're available for an immediate start 

- You have a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Architecture
- You have some experience at an architectural office
- You have a good understanding of the construction process
- You are a highly motivated ‘self-starter’
- You’re excited to collaborate with construction teams, architects, operations and project managers
- You're a quick learner who picks up new skills, digital tools and information quickly
- Strong Proficiency in English

**Benefits**

- Competitive salary + generous equity compensation
- Open and transparent culture
- Opportunity to join a talented seed-stage startup with proven traction early in its journey
- Completely different and dynamic work approach
- Positive working environment

jobs.title: QA Engineer
jobs.description:
Disperse is a VC-backed artificial intelligence construction startup focused on improving on-site productivity with the help of computer vision. Our goal is to ultimately re-imagine the way building projects are planned, delivered and operated.

We're currently working on some of the largest building projects in London (e.g. Renzo Piano’s Shard Place, Wood Wharf) and have grown from 5 to 35 people over the past year. We have ambitions to expand significantly, which means that we are looking for passionate and enthusiastic talent to join the team.

We move at a high speed, and will provide you with immense opportunities for initiative, creativity and leadership. [**Our proudly diverse, international team is based in London, Sarajevo and Yereva**](https://workable.com/nr?l=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.disperse.io%2Fteam%2F)[**n**](https://workable.com/nr?l=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.disperse.io%2Fteam%2F), and has a wealth of experience from construction management to computer vision and robotics.

**ROLE**

We are looking for two junior QA engineers to join our team in Yerevan on full-time basis. The opportunity involves working with the wider team on our web-based software solution, which provides a first-of-its-kind solution for reviewing on-site progress. As part of this role, you will be executing, writing and automating test cases, and collaborating closely with the engineering team and users to root cause bugs and to drive resolutions.

Desired start date as soon as possible.

**Our culture**

Ask anyone at Disperse what they love most about working here, and they'll probably tell you "it's the people!", "the team, of course", "the people and the Hedwig owls in the offices".

As clichéd as it may sound, we're very proud of the people we have and the close-knit, family culture we've built across London, Sarajevo and Yerevan. Despite the distances, we're united through the passion with which we approach our goals and the fun that we have along the way. We always look out for each other, no matter what. The following should give you a good idea what type of culture you'd be joining:

- We encourage proactivity and taking full ownership of problems and initiatives. We don't believe in micromanagement. Instead, we let you pave your own path and give you the space to continuously learn and grow even if it means taking a few detours.
- We support each other. If a process breaks or if you're struggling, you can always count on the people around you and the people far away from you, to help you get back on track.
- We run on feedback: direct and transparent praise and constructive criticism, communicated with the best of intentions. There is no other way to learn!
- Ideas and approaches are always judged on merit rather than source. We welcome discussions and challenges. This way everyone makes a tremendous impact no matter the role.

**As a QA Junior Engineer, you will:**

- Test system releases for possible regressions and errors according to the test plan
- Communicate with the team to understand application functionality and user behavior 
- Contribute in the test automation process
- Produce software test processes and plans for all aspects of the system
- Collaborate with the engineering team and users to root cause bugs, feedback around issues and to drive resolutions

**Requirements**

- Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or a related technical field
- Experience with modern web-based tools (Jira, Confluence, GSuite,, etc.)
- Good communication skills, both written and verbal 
- Attention to detail
- Proven ability to deliver on schedule
- Intermediate proficiency in English

**Benefits**

- Competitive salary
- Open and transparent culture
- Opportunity to join a talented seed-stage startup with proven traction early in its journey
- Regular mentoring and feedback

jobs.title: Construction Photo Surveyor/Site Scanner (Weekday Part-Time)
jobs.description:
Disperse is a VC-backed artificial intelligence construction startup focused on improving on-site productivity with the help of computer vision. Our goal is to ultimately re-imagine the way building projects are planned, delivered and operated.

Over the last couple of years, we’ve established our presence in the London market working on some of the largest building projects in the city (e.g. Renzo Piano’s Shard Place, Wood Wharf).

We are now kicking off our first projects in New York and require site scanners to liaise with our clients and collect high quality 360 degree images from their construction sites.

Your role

Delighting our clients repeatedly with a phenomenal user experience relies upon collecting top-quality image data from their construction sites. You will play a crucial role in our image collection process, contributing to our product by providing the data needed to create the 360 as-built environment that our clients browse through. We are looking for hardworking and conscientious workers to join our Site Scanners programme, with work offered on a part-time basis (usually 1-2 days/week).

If you are eager to learn and are not afraid to dive straight into new challenges, this role is a great opportunity to be part of something innovative and new. The role will expose you to some of the most anticipated construction sites in the city, offering you a rare chance to see these buildings come to life. We will compensate you generously and will award you with an additional bonus for outstanding work.

What your role will entail:

- Liasing with senior stakeholders at top construction companies in New York.
- Travelling on-site to some of the largest, most prestigious and complex construction sites across New York.
- Capturing panoramic scans and collecting progress data utilising 360 cameras.

In your application, please state the days that you would be available to work.

**Requirements**

You should apply if:

- You already completed the OSHA-30 Construction Safety Training
- You're available for half a day on 1-2 weekdays per week - in your application, please state the days that you would be available to work.
- You can read and discern construction drawings and documents
- You are detail-oriented and have exceptional organizational and time-management skills
- You are self-motivated and dependable team player
- You're a quick learner who picks new skills and information up quickly.
- You're physically well-conditioned and capable of walking through a construction site for up to 5 hours.
- You're safety-conscious and cognizant of the risks involved and how to avert them.

Useful but not essential:

- You have a background in construction management.
- You have a Secure Workers Access Consortium (SWAC) card.

**Benefits**

- Generous compensation ($40 per hour, up to $160 for a 4h working day).
- Exposure to highly innovative work in the field.
- Firsthand experience viewing and working on some of the most prominent projects in New York City.

jobs.title: Senior Backend Engineer
jobs.description:
**Your role**

We’re looking for an experienced backend engineer to play a key role in our growing software engineering team. Working primarily with a JavaScript stack, you’ll be collaborating with the CTO and Technical Lead to fundamentally reimagine how to structure the company’s data and expose it through consistent, well-documented interfaces. You’re someone who is extremely comfortable with databases both relational and non-relational, and can extract the best performance out of each of them via sensible design and optimised queries. As part of your core role, you’ll leverage your experience in designing and deploying RESTful and WebSocket APIs supported by a comprehensive test suite, working with AWS cloud computing, and designing asynchronous systems.

**Our culture**

Ask anyone at Disperse what they love most about working here, and they'll probably tell you "it's the people!", "the team, of course", "the people and the Hedwig owls in the offices".

As clichéd as it may sound, we're very proud of the people we have and the close-knit, family culture we've built across London, Sarajevo and Yerevan. Despite the distances, we're united through the passion with which we approach our goals and the fun that we have along the way. We always look out for each other, no matter what. The following should give you a good idea what type of culture you'd be joining:

- We encourage proactivity and taking full ownership of problems and initiatives. We don't believe in micromanagement. Instead, we let you pave your own path and give you the space to continuously learn and grow even if it means taking a few detours.
- We support each other. If a process breaks or if you're struggling, you can always count on the people around you and the people far away from you, to help you get back on track.
- We run on feedback: direct and transparent praise and constructive criticism, communicated with the best of intentions. There is no other way to learn!
- Ideas and approaches are always judged on merit rather than source. We welcome discussions and challenges. This way everyone makes a tremendous impact no matter the role.

**Requirements**

- A Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or a related technical field.
- 3+ years of web service backend development experience, ideally with a JavaScript stack.
- Substantial experience in relational and non-relational database design and optimisation, as well as API design.
- An affinity for test-driven development and continuous deployment.
- Track record of delivering with a small team to tight deadlines.
- Excellent communication and collaboration skills, including in English.

**Benefits**

- Competitive salary
- Comprehensive health insurance, including parents and dependents.
- Friendly, open and transparent culture.
- Opportunity to join a talented startup with proven traction on it's scaling journey
- Regular socials, and team retreats to amazing destinations (Tbilisi, Kiev... Where next?)

**The process**

1. A review of your application;

2. A 1-hour on-site chat where we can learn more about each other;

3. A 1-2 hour on-site technical chat and task to see how you tackle problems;

4. Two rounds of background and cultural chats with our London team and company leadership (video chat).

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.description:
Ever wondered how skyscrapers like The Shard or The Gherkin get built? Disperse uses AI and computer vision to revolutionise the construction of iconic buildings around the world, such as the upcoming 22 Bishopsgate - soon to be the UK's second tallest building.

Come join a creative, conscientious and proudly diverse community of AI researchers, software engineers, architects and designers dedicated to helping build the skylines of tomorrow!

**Role**

Software Engineers at Disperse are passionate about using technology to solve real user problems. We’re looking for experienced full-stack, backend and front-end developers to play a key role in our growing software engineering team.

You'll be iterating with design teams to build brand new software products from scratch, as well as recruiting and mentoring new developers as we undergo rapid expansion.

Our software is primarily web-based, built using a NodeJS JavaScript stack, and our infrastructure runs on AWS.

**Our culture**

Ask anyone at Disperse what they love most about working here, and they'll probably tell you "it's the people!", "the team, of course", "the people and the Hedwig owls in the offices".

As clichéd as it may sound, we're very proud of the people we have and the close-knit, family culture we've built across London, Sarajevo and Yerevan. Despite the distances, we're united through the passion with which we approach our goals and the fun that we have along the way. We always look out for each other, no matter what. The following should give you a good idea what type of culture you'd be joining:

- We encourage proactivity and taking full ownership of problems and initiatives. We don't believe in micromanagement. Instead, we let you pave your own path and give you the space to continuously learn and grow even if it means taking a few detours.
- We support each other. If a process breaks or if you're struggling, you can always count on the people around you and the people far away from you, to help you get back on track.
- We run on feedback: direct and transparent praise and constructive criticism, communicated with the best of intentions. There is no other way to learn!
- Ideas and approaches are always judged on merit rather than source. We welcome discussions and challenges. This way everyone makes a tremendous impact no matter the role.

**Requirements**

- A Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or a related technical field.
- 3+ years of either full-stack, backend or front-end development experience, ideally with a JavaScript stack.
- An affinity for test-driven development and continuous deployment.
- Track record of delivering with a small team to tight deadlines.
- Excellent communication and collaboration skills, including in English.

**Benefits**

- Competitive salary
- Fantastic growth opportunities: whether its product development workshops, leadership training or AI courses, we care about making your career progress in the direction you want.
- Friendly, open and transparent culture.
- Opportunity to join one of London's fastest growing and most exciting AI startups.
- Regular socials, and team retreats to amazing destinations (Tbilisi, Kiev... Where next?)

**The process**

1. A review of your application;

2. A 1-hour on-site chat where we can learn more about each other;

3. A 1-2 hour on-site technical chat and task to see how you tackle problems;

4. Two rounds of background and cultural chats with our London team and company leadership (video chat).

  • Friendly, open and transparent culture.
  • Opportunity to join one of London's fastest growing and most exciting AI startups.
  • Regular socials, and team retreats to amazing destinations (Tbilisi, Kiev... Where next?)

The process

  1. A review of your application;

  2. A 1-hour on-site chat where we can learn more about each other;

  3. A 1-2 hour on-site technical chat and task to see how you tackle problems;

  4. Two rounds of background and cultural chats with our London team and company leadership (video chat).

jobs.title: Lead QA Engineer
jobs.description:
**Your role**

We are looking for a lead QA engineer to join our team in Yerevan on full-time basis. The opportunity involves working with the wider team on our web-based software solution, which provides a first-of-its-kind solution for reviewing on-site progress. As part of this role, you will be executing, writing and automating test cases, and collaborating closely with the engineering team and users to root cause bugs and to drive resolutions.

Desired start date as soon as possible.

**Our culture**

Ask anyone at Disperse what they love most about working here, and they'll probably tell you "it's the people!", "the team, of course", "the people and the Hedwig owls in the offices".

As clichéd as it may sound, we're very proud of the people we have and the close-knit, family culture we've built across London, Sarajevo and Yerevan. Despite the distances, we're united through the passion with which we approach our goals and the fun that we have along the way. We always look out for each other, no matter what. The following should give you a good idea what type of culture you'd be joining:

- We encourage proactivity and taking full ownership of problems and initiatives. We don't believe in micromanagement. Instead, we let you pave your own path and give you the space to continuously learn and grow even if it means taking a few detours.
- We support each other. If a process breaks or if you're struggling, you can always count on the people around you and the people far away from you, to help you get back on track.
- We run on feedback: direct and transparent praise and constructive criticism, communicated with the best of intentions. There is no other way to learn!
- Ideas and approaches are always judged on merit rather than source. We welcome discussions and challenges. This way everyone makes a tremendous impact no matter the role.

**As a Lead QA Engineer, you will:**

- Test system releases for possible regressions and errors according to the test plan
- Communicate with the team to understand application functionality and user behaviour.
- Contribute in the test automation process
- Produce software test processes and plans for all aspects of the system
- Collaborate with the engineering team and users to root cause bugs, feedback around issues and to drive resolutions

**Requirements**

- Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or a related technical field
- 3+ years experience working as a QA engineer.
- Experience with modern web-based tools (Jira, Confluence, GSuite,, etc.)
- Good communication skills, both written and verbal 
- Attention to detail
- Proven ability to deliver on schedule
- Intermediate proficiency in English

**Benefits**

- Competitive salary
- Open and transparent culture
- Opportunity to join a talented seed-stage startup with proven traction early in its journey
- Regular mentoring and feedback

jobs.title: Business Development Representative - London
jobs.description:
We’re looking for someone who wants to bring a game-changing solution to an industry ripe for reinvention -- and help us connect with those who can use our platform to change the way we build.

This is a high-energy, new sales development role with a focus on finding new potential customers across the UK and European region. You will contribute to Disperse hyper-growth by helping to acquire new clients.

We are looking for driven professionals who are willing to strongly contribute and ready to work in a fast build & learn environment.

You will gain experience interacting with prospective clients of all levels and in an industry ready for transformation.

If you’re eager to learn and aren’t afraid to dive straight into new challenges, then this role is a great opportunity to develop a multidisciplinary skill-set alongside a world-class team.

In this role, you will:

- Research prospective customers, create outreach strategies, and identify sales opportunities
- Create and prioritize strategic target account lists
- Connect and conduct first-class exploratory conversations with potential customers
- Conduct needs qualification calls with specific prospects
- Work closely and collaboratively with Account Executives to develop and implement appropriate prospecting strategies and help fill their sales pipeline
- Achieve monthly quotas of qualified new business opportunities
- Have an opportunity to grow the BDR role/function/team

**Requirements**

You should apply if:

- Proven work experience as a Business Development Representative or in a B2B sales capacity (min. 1 year)
- Hands-on experience with multiple sales techniques (including calling)
- Track record of achieving sales/BDR quotas
- Experience with CRM software (e.g. Salesforce)
- Understanding of sales performance metrics 
- You possess excellent verbal and written communication skills

- You’re organised and methodical with a keen attention to detail
- You can think yourself deep into the mind of others to understand and address their key interests and challenges
- You’re a highly motivated ‘self-starter’ with professional persistence.
- You have an excellent track record of academic achievement and being a team player: down to earth and willing to do what it takes for the team to succeed.
- You’re eligible to work in the UK as no visa sponsorship is available for this position.

In addition, it is useful but not essential, if you have:

- Previous experience in a startup environment.
- Experience/knowledge of the construction industry
- French or German language is a plus.

**Benefits**

- Experience firsthand what it takes to scale up an AI startup
- Competitive compensation
- Friendly, open and transparent culture
- Health insurance (Vitality + Gym membership discounts)
- Pension scheme
- Flexible working hours / ability to work from home
- Choose your work equipment / devices: your local office will provide you with options to choose from to help you set up the systems and work environment that will keep you happy and productive
- Central London location (Tottenham Court Road)
- Regular socials, and team retreats to amazing destinations (Tbilisi, Kiev... Where next?)

jobs.title: Construction Site Scanner
jobs.description:
Disperse is a VC-backed artificial intelligence construction startup focused on improving on-site productivity with the help of computer vision. Our goal is to ultimately re-imagine the way building projects are planned, delivered and operated.

Over the last couple of years, we’ve established our presence in the London market working on some of the largest building projects in the city (e.g. Renzo Piano’s Shard Place, Wood Wharf).

We are now kicking off our first projects in New York and require site scanners to liaise with our clients and collect high quality 360 degree images from their construction sites.

**Your role**

Delighting our clients repeatedly with a phenomenal user experience relies upon collecting top-quality image data from their construction sites. You will play a crucial role in our image collection process, contributing to our product by providing the data needed to create the 360 as-built environment that our clients browse through. We are looking for hardworking and conscientious workers to join our Site Scanners programme, with work offered on a part-time basis (usually 1-2 days/week).

If you are eager to learn and are not afraid to dive straight into new challenges, this role is a great opportunity to be part of something innovative and new. The role will expose you to some of the most anticipated construction sites in the city, offering you a rare chance to see these buildings come to life. We will compensate you generously and will award you with an additional bonus for outstanding work.

What your role will entail:

- Liasing with senior stakeholders at top construction companies in Utica.
- Travelling on-site to some of the largest and complex construction sites.
- Capturing panoramic scans and collecting progress data utilising 360 cameras.

In your application, please state the days that you would be available to work.

**Requirements**

You should apply if:

- You have already completed the OSHA-30 Construction Safety Training
- You're available for half a day on 1-2 weekdays per week - in your application, please state the days that you would be available to work.
- You can read and discern construction drawings and documents
- You are detail-oriented and have exceptional organizational and time-management skills
- You are self-motivated and dependable team player
- You're a quick learner who picks new skills and information up quickly.
- You're physically well-conditioned and capable of walking through a construction site for up to 5 hours.
- You're safety-conscious and cognizant of the risks involved and how to avert them.

Useful but not essential:

- You have a background in construction management.
- You have a Secure Workers Access Consortium (SWAC) card

**Benefits**

- Generous compensation ($40 per hour, up to $160 for a 4h working day).
- Exposure to highly innovative work in the field.
- Firsthand experience viewing and working on some of the most prominent projects in Utica.

jobs.title: DevOps and Automation Engineer (Yerevan, Sarajevo, London)
jobs.description:
**What Disperse does**

Ever wondered how skyscrapers like The Shard or The Gherkin get built? Disperse uses AI and computer vision to revolutionise the construction of iconic buildings around the world, such as the upcoming 22 Bishopsgate - soon to be the UK's second tallest building.

Come join a creative, conscientious and proudly diverse community of AI researchers, software engineers, architects and designers dedicated to helping build the skylines of tomorrow!

**Working as a DevOps Engineer at Disperse**

You'll be working closely with our engineering and computer vision research teams to deploy and operate our software.

Your responsibilities will include automated deployment, management and monitoring of development and production systems and ensuring high availability and smooth operation of our platform for our engineering team and customers.

You'll also be one of the first engineers in our London office, which means it's up to you to define the culture and to nurture future individuals that join our rapidly growing team.

**Requirements**

**Must-haves**

- You enjoy learning and working independently and can make decisions with minimal supervision
- You're excited about taking computer vision out of the lab and putting it to work on real-life problems
- You're familiar with data structures, storage systems, cloud infrastructure, front-end frameworks, and other technical tools
- You have a strong engineering background in a subject like Computer Science, Mathematics, Software Engineering or Physics

**Bonus points if:**

- You've worked with Amazon AWS
- You have a strong background in Linux based systems
- You have experience implementing IT automation
- You've had experience with small start-up environments

**Benefits**

- We host a bi-annual, company-wide Hack Week. Put your day job on hold and work on whatever you want, with whomever you want, then present what you've made to the entire company. Great for dusting off that cool idea you've been pondering but never had the time to build.
- Competitive salary and a generous equity package, along with a desk at our beautiful central London office. Our benefits also include a company laptop, flexible working hours and health insurance. We can also be extra-flexible if you have (or are planning to have) young children

jobs.title: Enterprise Account Director (New York)
jobs.description:
**About us**

Ever wondered how skyscrapers like One Vanderbilt get built? It takes a heroic effort across a huge team of designers, builders, and managers to name a few. But we know that the process isn’t ideal - 69% of projects run more than 10% over budget and 75% are completed significantly late. Disperse is overcoming these challenges by putting digital tools in the hands of the construction industry. [**We use AI and computer vision to revolutionize the way buildings are built around the world**](https://cheddar.com/media/disperse-raises-million-to-bring-a-i-to-construction-sites).

Over the past year, our four offices (London, New York, Sarajevo, and Yerevan) have joined forces to build a product and service that our customers love. Having just raised a Series A funding round, we’re kickstarting a new stage of global growth and are looking to build a team to help drive the next phase of our journey.

Come join Disperse -- a creative, conscientious, and proudly diverse community of AI researchers, software engineers, architects, and designers dedicated to helping build the skylines of tomorrow!

### Your role

There is no better time to join our growing team, as you will have the rare opportunity to establish yourself as first Sales leader and a core part of our **US founding team in New York**. You will have the unique opportunity to determine our early entrepreneurial path of rapidly scaling across a new market and unlocking the [trillion dollar construction productivity gap](https://medium.com/northzone/closing-the-trillion-dollar-productivity-gap-in-construction-our-investment-in-disperse-e2c00af825df) and help build Disperse's North American Sales Growth team

The Enterprise Account Director will leverage their experience as solution seller at the C-suite, knowledge of industry & technology trends, and an ability to communicate a powerful story to help senior decision makers at some of the largest real-estate development and construction organizations transition into the digital economy and relish productivity efficiencies and new operating models.

Typical duties include:

- Passionately represent Disperse, our vision and develop strong relationships to grow the Disperse product and brand across the North American market
- Evangelize Disperse's brand in the marketplace by presenting, promoting and selling Disperse's solution and leveraging a consultative, value selling approach
- Build and maintain quality relationships with key Disperse partners to grow our business across North America
- Build creative account strategies that revolve around delivering optimal outcomes for our customers and stakeholders based on their needs, operations and visions
- Grow and manage the Sales and Account management team in line with Disperse's growth targets and aspirations
- Build out and manage Disperse's BDR Growth team to build out a scalable and sustainable lead generation engine
- Create comprehensive and compelling business proposals that challenge the status-quo and convince decision makers with crystal clear added-vale
- Manage named accounts through the pipeline from doing the right qualification and scoping of opportunities to closing them
- Assess the resources required, the chances of closure, the process & timing and the financial benefits. This is crucial to our success and so is the ability to report sales activity and track results at all times
- Step up in the final stages, get the P.O. and consistently achieve quarterly and annual sales quotas
-  
- Partner with our Customer Success and Product teams to ensure our customers receive maximum value

**Requirements**

- B2B software experience: 6-10 years solution/value selling, 4+ years Enterprise accounts experience
- Knowledgeable and ready: This is a senior role and our space is complex and we are early in our journey
- Hunter profile: You're driven and self-motivated. You are hungry and have a track record of over-achieving quota to testify
- Seasoned: Experience managing complex software sales cycle from business champion to the C-level is key
- People Management: Experience growing and managing hyper scale up Sales and Account Management teams
- Energetic: You thrive in a fast-paced environment
- Construction Industry and/or previous hyper-growth scale up experience is a plus

**Benefits**

- Competitive salary and generous option package
- Health insurance options
- 23 days' holiday plus all federal holidays
- Friendly, open and transparent culture
- Choose your work equipment / devices: we'll provide you with options to choose from to help you set up the systems and work environment that will keep you happy and productive
- Flexible working hours / ability to work from home
- Exciting midtown office 
- Unlimited coffee, tea (and nearly unlimited fresh fruit, muffins and cupcakes)
- Regular socials, and team retreats to amazing destinations (Tbilisi, Kiev... Where next?)

Disperse welcomes applications from all sections of society. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other basis as protected by applicable law. If you have a disability or additional need that requires accommodation, please do not hesitate to let us know.

### The process

The interview process will involve:

1. An initial 1-hour interview with a senior member of our business development team
2. 1-hour onsite interview: with members of the business development, product, and project delivery team
3. 1-hour on-site interview with teams: presentation of take home sales task with Q&A followed by technical and personal fit chats with different team members of the team
4. 1-hour on-site interview with different members of the team

**THE ROLE**

We are looking for our first Finance Manager, for someone to build out our finance capability and to provide financial advisory on strategic company decisions as we progress on our international expansion and for Series B.

As Finance Manager, you will have the opportunity to model and forecast business scenarios, build and track performance metrics, price and evaluate new opportunities, and manage our accounting responsibilities and budgets. Analytical and hands-on, you are a problem-solver at heart and always on the look-out for business opportunities and process improvements. An avid team player, you work to make others around you better as you position yourself to support the strategic and financial planning processes of our global teams.

**Responsibilities:**

- Define and track critical success metrics; identify key opportunities and challenges and collaborate with the business to address them
- Develop and manage our accounting and reporting processes, and oversee our responsibilities with month-end and quarter-end closes
- Drive the development and management of our financial modelling and forecasting; manage and track the budgets and performance of assigned P&L accounts
- Model out business scenarios for initiatives and opportunities, including these for financial planning
- Run regular in-depth analysis on our financials to gain key insights and to ensure the accuracy and integrity of our records
- Find and drive process improvement opportunities across each of our global teams and process areas
- Work closely with the leadership team on strategy, roadmap and targets for the business, and advise on hiring, market opportunities and prioritisation decisions
- Liaise with our investors, vendors and business partners on investment round collateral, key financial deliverables and other ad hoc requests

**Requirements**

**You should apply if:**

- You have at least 2+ years of experience in FP&A, commercial or corporate finance roles
- You have experience of working in a fast-growth environment
- You have experience from a company with best-in-class reporting practices
- You have excellent verbal and written communication skills
- You have a proven ability to build and manage financial models
- You think analytically; you thrive working with data and extracting insights to make strong business cases
- You love Excel and financial modelling, and have experience from financial and strategic planning
- You are proactive and hands-on, and relish taking on new challenges

**Plus:**

- If you have previous experience of working in the technology or construction
- ACA/CIMA/ACCA qualified

**Benefits**

- Competitive package
- Private health insurance
- 25 days’ holiday plus all bank holidays
- Friendly, open and transparent culture
- Choose your work equipment / devices: your local office will provide you with options to choose from to help you set up the systems and work environment that will keep you happy and productive
- Flexible working hours / ability to work from home
- Central London location (Tottenham Court Road)
- Unlimited coffee, tea (and nearly unlimited cinnamon loaf from Ole and Steen!)
- Regular socials, and team retreats to amazing destinations (Tbilisi, Kiev... Where next?)

Disperse welcomes applications from all sections of society. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other basis as protected by applicable law. If you have a disability or additional need that requires accommodation, please do not hesitate to let us know.
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Ever wondered how skyscrapers like The Shard get built? It takes a heroic effort across a huge team of designers, builders, and managers to name a few. But we know that the process isn’t ideal - 69% of projects run more than 10% over budget and 75% are completed significantly late. Disperse is overcoming these challenges by putting digital tools in the hands of the construction industry. We use AI and computer vision to revolutionise the way buildings are built around the world.

Over the past year, our four offices (London (HQ), New York, Sarajevo, and Yerevan) have joined forces to build a product and service that our customers love. Having just raised a Series A funding round, we’re kickstarting a new stage of global growth and are looking to build a team to help drive the next phase of our journey.

jobs.title: Growth Associate / Venture Development (New York)
jobs.description:
We’re looking for someone versatile and entrepreneurial who is excited at the prospect of building a high-growth AI venture in a new country: an imaginative tinkerer who thrives wearing multiple hats and seeks out adventurous challenges. Someone who can tackle problems across a variety of roles: from strategic growth initiatives, product design and business development, to analytics, project management and operations. If you’re eager to learn and aren’t afraid to dive straight into new challenges, then this role is a great opportunity to grow and develop a multidisciplinary skill-set as part of a world-class team.

You will learn about all areas of the business and will be expected to contribute in every area, as we all do. Working alongside our founding team, you will have a lot of ownership from day one, and will experience firsthand what it takes to scale up an AI startup. You will receive regular mentoring from different members of the team to make your experience at Disperse the best it can be.

This is an opportunity to join in at the start of something new, and if you prove to be a great fit after the trial period, we’ll happily convert you to a full-time position. We've had great success with our former Venture Developers [Noor](https://workable.com/nr?l=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.linkedin.com%2Fin%2Fnoorkhouri%2F) (Product Manager), [Ben](https://workable.com/nr?l=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.linkedin.com%2Fin%2Fbenedict-wigmore-643a5bb8%2F) (Process Exploration Lead), [Lionel](https://workable.com/nr?l=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.linkedin.com%2Fin%2Flionel-thienpont%2F) (Head of Projects), Valentina (Growth Strategy Manager), and Sibylle (Marketing Manager) who rapidly took on huge amounts of responsibility and became integral pillars of Disperse.

Some of the work that you might be doing includes:

- Conducting market and customer research for our market expansion value proposition and product development. 
- Designing and launching growth marketing hacking experiments to drive business development, forge industry relationships and grow our on-demand platforms.
- Developing strong relationships with our customer’s teams and people.
- Supporting the marketing and business development team in developing pitches and communicating our value proposition to prospective and existing customers.
- Supporting the pricing team in analysing prospective projects and preparing quotes.
- Designing and launching hypothesis-driven prototype experiments, gather and observe customer feedback and iterate to move towards expanding value for our customers.
- Operationalising our project, product, and business development processes.
- Streamlining internal operations and OKR tracking.

**Requirements**

- You’re available for an immediate start.
- You have less than a year of full-time work experience.
- You’re excited about joining us full-time immediately after the 4-month probation period, subject to our finding a mutual long-term fit.
- You have an excellent track record of academic achievement.
- You’re ambitious and passionate about creating something meaningful.
- You’re a problem solver: you don’t accept the status quo and are always looking for creative solutions. 
- You think analytically: you love working with data and extracting insights to make strong business cases.
- You’re an excellent written and verbal communicator with a knack for always finding the right tone.
- You’re a lifelong learner who picks up new skills and information quickly.
- You’re organised and methodical with a keen attention to detail.
- You’re a highly motivated ‘self-starter’.
- You’re eligible to work in the US as no visa sponsorship is available for this position. 

Useful but not essential:

- Previous experience in a startup environment.
- Technical knowledge and understanding of software development.

**Benefits**

- Private health insurance.
- 23 days’ holiday plus all federal holidays.
- Friendly, open and transparent culture.
- Flexible working hours / ability to work from home.
- Unlimited craft coffee from an onsite barista.
- Regular socials and team retreats to amazing destinations.

Disperse welcomes applications from all sections of society. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other basis as protected by applicable law. If you have a disability or additional need that requires accommodation, please do not hesitate to let us know.

### The process

The interview process will involve:

1. An initial 30-minute chat to get to know you
2. A 1-hour on-site interview with members of the product, marketing and commercial team
3. A take home task to understand your approach toward problem solving 
4. A 1-hour on-site interview to present the home task with Q&A, followed by technical and cultural chats with different members of the team
5. A final on-site interview with different members of the team

This process should take up to two weeks, depending on diaries. Please note that if you are not currently based in London or New York, we would be happy to speak with you over video chat.

jobs.title: Mechanical Engineer Junior
jobs.description:
**Your role**

We’re looking for a versatile Mechanical Engineer Junior to join our team. Someone who can quickly take ownership across a variety of roles, from analysing project documentation, project managing the delivery and quality across customer accounts, to supporting the design of our product and processes. If you’re eager to learn, and aren’t afraid to dive straight into new challenges, this is a unique opportunity to be part of creating the way buildings will be designed, built and operated in the future.

The job of a mechanical engineer at Disperse isn’t like your typical mechanical engineer gig. We harness the characteristics that come naturally to engineers: creative problem-solvers, being bottomless idea wells, superhuman work ethics, and the ability to adapt on the fly - and unleash these across the business. You’ll find yourself as part-construction, architecture and mechanical specialist, part-digital product designer, part-business strategist, as well as the voice of the industry.

Your main responsibility will be to ensure that we onboard new projects, focusing on MEP phase, project manage their delivery and deliver value to our customers from day one. It’ll be your job to create the connection between our customer's project plans, the construction site and our product. You’ll be working in our project team, as well closely with our customers, product and software engineering teams. You’ll be experiencing first-hand what it takes to scale up a tech startup and will get the opportunity to work on some of the most prestigious projects in the world, starting from UK and US market.

NOTE: This role is available in Sarajevo and Mostar (Bosnia and Herzegovina). Strictly non-remote.

Desired start date as soon as possible.

**Our culture**

Ask anyone at Disperse what they love most about working here, and they'll probably tell you "it's the people!", "the team, of course", "the people and the Hedwig owls in the offices".

As clichéd as it may sound, we're very proud of the people we have and the close-knit, family culture we've built across London, Sarajevo, Mostar and Yerevan. Despite the distances, we're united through the passion with which we approach our goals and the fun that we have along the way. The following should give you a good idea what type of culture you'd be joining:

- We encourage proactivity and taking full ownership of problems and initiatives. We don't believe in micromanagement. Instead, we let you pave your own path and give you the space to continuously learn and grow even if it means taking a few detours.
- We support each other. If a process breaks or if you're struggling, you can always count on the people around you and the people far away from you, to help you get back on track.
- We run on feedback: direct and transparent praise and constructive criticism, communicated with the best of intentions. There is no other way to learn!
- Ideas and approaches are always judged on merit rather than source. We welcome discussions and challenges. This way everyone makes a tremendous impact no matter the role.

**Requirements**

You should apply if:

- You are ambitious and passionate about creating something meaningful
- You're available for an immediate start 

- You have a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Mechanical engineering
- You have a good understanding of MEP systems of residential and non-residential buildings
- You are familiar with BIM 
- You are a highly motivated ‘self-starter’
- You’re excited to collaborate with construction teams, architects, operations and project managers
- You're a quick learner who picks up new skills, digital tools and information quickly
- Strong Proficiency in English

**Benefits**

- Competitive salary + generous equity compensation
- Open and transparent culture
- Opportunity to join a talented seed-stage startup with proven traction early in its journey
- Completely different and dynamic work approach
- Positive working environment

jobs.title: Operations Coordinator
jobs.description:
We are looking for a dedicated and organised Operations Coordinator to lead our site scanning operations in the US from our New York office. We need a bold, action-oriented problem solver with people management or team lead experience.

You will be responsible for coordinating needs between our clients and our freelancers, and for ensuring that everything we do is streamlined, and operating like a well-oiled machine.

This role places you at the forefront of our day-to-day operations in the US office, giving you responsibility and ownership from day one. You’ll be responsible for scaling our operations while maintaining and improving on aggressive quality and efficiency metrics.

 

Some of the work that you will be doing includes:

 
- Managing our team of freelance site scanners, assuring that we deliver on time and with the highest level of quality
- Coordinating recruitment and onboarding of new site scanners in line with project growth
- Liaising with clients and internal teams to make sure the requirements are communicated swiftly such that new projects are onboarded into site scanning operations while maintaining a high level of accuracy throughout.
- Monitoring progress across all projects and solving potential issues.
- Contributing to the development and evolution of our processes and ways of working.

**Requirements**

Our ideal candidate will:

 
- Thrive at solving problems quickly and can keep cool in stressful situations.
- Have a strong bias for action.
- Excel at cross-functional teamwork & communication.
- Have excellent time management and organisational skills.
- Be analytical with a desire to measure outcomes.
- Be an excellent written and verbal communicator with a knack for always finding the right tone.
- Have 1 to 2 years of professional experience, preferably in operations or process management.
- Be eligible to work in the US. No visa sponsorship is available for this position.

**Benefits**

- Pro rata salary of $45,000 to $60,000 per annum 
- Private health insurance.
- 23 days’ holiday plus all federal holidays.
- Friendly, open and transparent culture.
- Flexible working hours / ability to work from home.
- Unlimited craft coffee from an onsite barista.
- Regular socials and team retreats to amazing destinations.

### The Process

The interview process will involve:

1. A review of your application;
2. A 15-minute chat where we can learn more about each other;
3. Two rounds of background and cultural chats with the team.
4. Final round to iron out any remaining questions

jobs.title: Operations Coordinator - Internship
jobs.description:
We are looking for a dedicated and organised Operations Coordinator Intern to oversee the day to day maintenance of our site scanning operations in London. We need a bold, action-oriented problem solver with people management or team lead experience.

You will be responsible for coordinating our freelancers, and for ensuring that everything we do is streamlined, and operating like a well-oiled machine.

 

This internship places you at the forefront of our day-to-day operations, giving you responsibility and ownership from day one. You’ll be responsible for helping to scale our operations while maintaining and improving on aggressive quality and efficiency metrics.

 

This is an opportunity to join a high growth start-up in a fascinating industry for 3 to 6 months throughout the year. If you prove to be a great fit after the internship period, we’ll happily convert you to a full-time position.

 

Some of the work that you will be doing includes:

 
- Managing our team of freelance site scanners, assuring that we deliver on time and with the highest level of quality
- Coordinating recruitment and onboarding of new site scanners in line with project growth
- Liaising with Project Coordinators and internal teams to make sure the requirements are communicated swiftly and that new projects are onboarded into site scanning operations while maintaining a high level of accuracy throughout.
- Monitoring progress across all projects and solving potential issues.
- Contributing to the development and evolution of our processes and ways of working.

**Requirements**

Our ideal candidate will:

- Thrive at solving problems quickly and can keep cool in stressful situations.
- Have a strong bias for action.
- Excel at cross-functional teamwork & communication.
- Have excellent time management and organisational skills.
- Be analytical with a desire to measure outcomes.
- Be an excellent written and verbal communicator with a knack for always finding the right tone.
- Be available to start immediately - this is not an internship for the summer period, we'd like someone to join as soon as possible!
- Be eligible to work in the UK. No visa sponsorship is available for this position.

In addition, it is useful but not essential, if:

- You have previous experience in the construction industry, either U.K. or internationally
- You have previous experience in a startup environment or in an operations role

**Benefits**

- Pro rata salary of £18,000 per annum for the duration of the internship (3 to 6 months). If you prove to be a great fit after the internship period, we’ll happily offer you a full-time position as Operations Coordinator with a pro rata salary of £32,000 per annum
- Friendly, open and transparent culture
- You'll get to join a passionate startup with proven traction on its scaling journey
- Flexible working hours / ability to work from home
- Awesome startup office in [Central London, Fitzrovia](https://workable.com/nr?l=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.theofficegroup.co.uk%2Foffice%2F2-stephen-street%2F%3Futm_source%3Dgoogle%26utm_medium%3Dlocal%26utm_campaign%3D2-stephen-street) 
- 25 days’ holiday plus all bank holidays (pro rata)
- Free coffee
- Regular socials, and team retreats to amazing destinations (Tbilisi, Kiev... Where next?)

You will be responsible for coordinating our freelancers, and for ensuring that everything we do is streamlined, and operating like a well-oiled machine.

This internship places you at the forefront of our day-to-day operations, giving you responsibility and ownership from day one. You’ll be responsible for helping to scale our operations while maintaining and improving on aggressive quality and efficiency metrics.

This is an opportunity to join a high growth start-up in a fascinating industry for 3 to 6 months throughout the year. If you prove to be a great fit after the internship period, we’ll happily convert you to a full-time position.

Some of the work that you will be doing includes:

  • Managing our team of freelance site scanners, assuring that we deliver on time and with the highest level of quality
  • Coordinating recruitment and onboarding of new site scanners in line with project growth
  • Liaising with Project Coordinators and internal teams to make sure the requirements are communicated swiftly and that new projects are onboarded into site scanning operations while maintaining a high level of accuracy throughout.
  • Monitoring progress across all projects and solving potential issues.
  • Contributing to the development and evolution of our processes and ways of working.

Requirements

Our ideal candidate will:

  • Thrive at solving problems quickly and can keep cool in stressful situations.
  • Have a strong bias for action.
  • Excel at cross-functional teamwork & communication.
  • Have excellent time management and organisational skills.
  • Be analytical with a desire to measure outcomes.
  • Be an excellent written and verbal communicator with a knack for always finding the right tone.
  • Be available to start immediately - this is not an internship for the summer period, we'd like someone to join as soon as possible!
  • Be eligible to work in the UK. No visa sponsorship is available for this position.

In addition, it is useful but not essential, if:

  • You have previous experience in the construction industry, either U.K. or internationally
  • You have previous experience in a startup environment or in an operations role

Benefits

  • Pro rata salary of £18,000 per annum for the duration of the internship (3 to 6 months). If you prove to be a great fit after the internship period, we’ll happily offer you a full-time position as Operations Coordinator with a pro rata salary of £32,000 per annum
  • Friendly, open and transparent culture
  • You'll get to join a passionate startup with proven traction on its scaling journey
  • Flexible working hours / ability to work from home
  • Awesome startup office in Central London, Fitzrovia
  • 25 days’ holiday plus all bank holidays (pro rata)
  • Free coffee
  • Regular socials, and team retreats to amazing destinations (Tbilisi, Kiev... Where next?)

jobs.title: Operations Data Analyst
jobs.description:
**What Disperse does**

Ever wondered how skyscrapers like The Shard or The Gherkin get built? Disperse uses AI and computer vision to revolutionise the construction of iconic buildings around the world, such as the upcoming 22 Bishopsgate - soon to be the UK's second tallest building.

Come join a creative, conscientious and proudly diverse community of AI researchers, software engineers, architects and designers dedicated to helping build the skylines of tomorrow!

**The Role**

We are looking for a code-competent and proactive problem-solver to join our fast-growing team in Sarajevo in the Data-Streams team. You will be helping the team tackle a breadth of operational challenges and problems from helping launch our product on new projects to driving process improvement and innovation to execute on our long-term roadmap.

**Responsibilities:**

- Automation of operational processes
- Working on data-related challenges, and collecting, aggregating and analysing data across different data streams to meet individual customer needs
- Driving operational excellence to improve our project delivery processes and tools
- Designing and implementing best practices and standardised work processes

**Our culture**

Ask anyone at Disperse what they love most about working here, and they'll probably tell you "it's the people!", "the team, of course", "the people and the Hedwig owls in the offices".

As clichéd as it may sound, we're very proud of the people we have and the close-knit, family culture we've built across London, Sarajevo, Mostar, Yerevan and now New York. Despite the distances, we're united through the passion with which we approach our goals and the fun that we have along the way. We always look out for each other, no matter what. The following should give you a good idea what type of culture you'd be joining:

- We encourage pro-activity and taking full ownership of problems and initiatives. We don't believe in micromanagement. Instead, we let you pave your own path and give you the space to continuously learn and grow even if it means taking a few detours.
- We support each other. If a process breaks or if you're struggling, you can always count on the people around you and the people far away from you, to help you get back on track.
- We run on feedback: direct and transparent praise and constructive criticism, communicated with the best of intentions. There is no other way to learn!
- Ideas and approaches are always judged on merit rather than source. We welcome discussions and challenges. This way everyone makes a tremendous impact no matter the role

**Requirements**

You should apply if:

- You have SQL, VBA or Python experience
- You have the ability to identify problems and independently drive creative solutions forward
- You ideally have 1-2 years of full-time work experience
- You have a strong academic background

**Benefits**

- Competitive salary + generous equity compensation
- Open and transparent culture
- Opportunity to join a talented seed-stage startup with proven traction early in its journey
- Completely different and dynamic work approach
- Positive working environment

jobs.title: Project Manager (NYC)
jobs.description:
We are looking for an experienced, ambitious and driven Project Manager to drive the deployment of our solution with our customers, where the ideal candidate helps implement best practices and new methodologies and successfully drives the overall delivery excellence and customer success for our projects. You will be responsible for driving the delivery across our clients while working closely with cross-functional teams (including technical experts) to deliver defined outputs to time and quality criteria.

As part of this role, you will:

- Drive the delivery and customer success across our customers
- Develop customer relationships that promote customer engagement and satisfaction
- Track and manage delivery output and performance against key KPIs (quality, time)
- Work closely with cross-functional teams to deliver outcomes in a highly-matrixed environment
- Ensure that our customers have the best Disperse experience possible, leading implementation sessions, organise training sessions, and drive the fast resolution of issues and inquiries
- Develop and implement best practices, new methodologies and process steps to drive overall delivery excellence

**Requirements**

You should apply if:

- You have 3-5+ years of experience in consulting, project management, or related field (bonus points for engineering, construction or manufacturing background)
- You have strong experience of working with cross-functional teams with a formalized methodology
- You have strong experience in managing issues, scope and quality
- You have excellent communication skills with strong customer-orientation
- You love to get involved in all areas of the business and get hands-on in day-to-day activities
- You are an avid team player and work to make everyone around you better
- You are proactive and hands-on, and relish taking on new challenges

**Benefits**

- Private health insurance.
- 23 days’ holiday plus all federal holidays.
- Friendly, open and transparent culture.
- Flexible working hours / ability to work from home.
- Unlimited craft coffee from an onsite barista.
- Regular socials and team retreats to amazing destinations.

Disperse welcomes applications from all sections of society. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other basis as protected by applicable law. If you have a disability or additional need that requires accommodation, please do not hesitate to let us know.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.description:
**What Disperse does**

Ever wondered how skyscrapers like The Shard or The Gherkin get built? Disperse uses AI and computer vision to revolutionise the construction of iconic buildings around the world, such as the upcoming 22 Bishopsgate - soon to be the UK's second tallest building.

Come join a creative, conscientious and proudly diverse community of AI researchers, software engineers, architects and designers dedicated to helping build the skylines of tomorrow!

**Working as a Software Engineer at Disperse**

You'll be working closely with our London client-base to understand their needs and translate that into new software tools.

You'll also be working with our computer vision scientists to turn research algorithms into production quality software that can be deployed on billion-pound construction projects.

As a full-stack engineer your role will be highly varied. You might be designing distributed computing pipelines in Python, deploying and configuring our AWS based stack, or developing web applications using Node.js and Vue.js.

You'll also be one of the first engineers in our London office, which means it's up to you to define the culture and to nurture future engineers that join our rapidly growing team.

**Requirements**

**Must-haves**

- You enjoy learning and working independently and can make decisions with minimal supervision
- You have a strong product-mindset and want to build pragmatic solutions that provide genuine user value
- You're excited about taking computer vision out of the lab and putting it to work on real-life problems
- You're familiar with data structures, storage systems, cloud infrastructure, front-end frameworks, and other technical tools
- You have a strong engineering background in a subject like Computer Science, Mathematics, Software Engineering or Physics

**Bonus points if:**

- You've worked with Amazon AWS stacks (we use products like EC2, S3, Lambda and SageMaker)
- You can write code in Python and might have used TensorFlow or pyTorch before
- You can write code in JavaScript and are familiar with a modern front end framework like VueJS
- You've had experience with small start-up environments

**Benefits**

**What we can offer you**

- We're growing so fast that we have a surplus of career paths available for you. Want to be a leader and learn how to manage teams? Done! Care more about product development and want training on how to run your own design workshop? We can do that too! Or are you more interested in AI and computer vision? You'll be working alongside the best researchers in the industry, and we'll sponsor you for an online Nanodegree through Udacity.
- We host a bi-annual, company-wide Hack Week. Put your day job on hold and work on whatever you want, with whomever you want, then present what you've made to the entire company. Great for dusting off that cool idea you've been pondering but never had the time to build.
- Competitive salary and a generous equity package, along with a desk at our beautiful central London office. Our benefits also include a company laptop, flexible working hours and health insurance. We can also be extra-flexible if you have (or are planning to have) young children.

jobs.title: Strategic Customer Lead (New York)
jobs.description:
**About Us**

Ever wondered how skyscrapers like One World Trade get built? It takes a heroic effort across a huge team of designers, builders, and managers, to name a few. But everyone in the industry knows that the process isn’t ideal: almost 70% of projects run more than 10% over budget, and 75% are completed significantly late. Disperse is helping our customers overcome these challenges by empowering them to transform. We provide cutting edge AI (computer vision) solutions to revolutionize the way construction gets delivered.

 

Over the past year, our four offices (London, New York, Sarajevo, and Yerevan) have joined forces to build a product and service that our customers love. We’ve just raised a Series A funding round, and we’re kickstarting a new stage of global growth. If you’re entrepreneurial, motivated to solve new problems and unafraid of new challenges, you’re right for Disperse - a creative, conscientious, and proudly diverse community of AI experts, software engineers, architects, designers and businesspeople dedicated to helping build the skylines of tomorrow!

 

**Your Role**

Sitting within our business development team, the Strategic Customer Lead is responsible for growing relationships within our most important customer accounts, closing the loop between customer needs and product design and guiding customers on their digital transformation journeys as we scale with them. This role exists at the intersection of solution engineering, product management and customer success, and responsibilities include identifying and building strong relationships with key stakeholders in our customer organizations, defining vision and success roadmaps and helping customers to succeed in their mission to improve how they build. The role also holds great influence over the direction and development of new product features and our product roadmap; you’ll need to take the lead on structuring product feature experiments, collecting and sorting through North American customer feedback- understanding and unpicking where the true value lies, identifying which solution elements are top priorities and then working with product managers, designers and engineers to integrate new developments into the product development pipeline.

 

Over the past 24 months we’ve landed successful pilot programs with key customers and expanded across project portfolios with a project-by-project sales model at some of the largest, most forward-thinking real estate developers and contractors in the U.K. and US. But, for this next stage of growth, we need to build on this momentum to establish deeper, enterprise-level partnerships and transition from a value-add partner to the core platform with which our customers manage and deliver construction projects at scale across their portfolios.

 

You will be responsible for making the case for Disperse scaling within these organizations, including both the financial case in ROI calculations and the non-financial elements of our value proposition for different users at different customer organizations (contractors, developers and financiers, etc), and running various product experiment to unlock enterprise value.

 

We are a scale-up, which means what you do day to day will change. We value versatile and entrepreneurial candidates who thrive wearing multiple hats and seek opportunities to build and improve outcomes, processes and ways of working. Within the Customer team, we work closely with: the Product team to structure and guide product feature experiments, inform and guide the development roadmap, the Project Delivery team to support project kick-offs and pilot success, the Marketing team to document and amplify success stories. We value candidates who are empathetic to the needs and workload of others, a clear communicator and supportive team player. If you’re eager to learn and aren’t afraid to dive straight into new challenges, then this role is a great opportunity to grow and develop a multidisciplinary skill-set as part of a world-class team.

**Some of the work that you might be doing includes:**

- Growing strong relationships with our senior stakeholders at our most important customer accounts to establish us an advisor on their digital productivity journey. Understand their strategic priorities, what keeps them up at night, and what their vision for the future of the industry is (or help them formulate it), and position ourselves firmly in the center
- Make the case for scaling within our customer accounts, moving from our first proof of value project, to multiple projects and becoming the de facto solution across the full portfolio. Develop our Enterprise proposition; how we can truly move the needle at an organizational level for our customers and champions. Building out a scalable, repeatable model and structure for growing strategic accounts
- Build a clear perspective and framework for informing the prioritization of our product roadmap in tandem with priorities, technologies and initiatives our strategic customers are driving, with a clear bias towards generating holistic value vs vanity tech 
- Prioritize, co-design and manage new product feature experiments across customer accounts to ensure we are moving in the right direction on a customer account and product-level 
- Form and uphold the culture of the company and the personal development of the Strategic Customer team members

**Requirements**

- You have worked for 3-5 years in a customer facing and / or product management role
- You are a structured thinker and problem-solver, with excellent written and verbal communicator and a knack for always finding the right tone
- You are personable, and genuinely care about helping others succeed, both within customer organizations and within your team
- You enjoy telling stories to guide customer’s thinking, both in person and through content
- You love working with data, extracting insights and translating them into strong business cases
- You are solution-oriented: you don’t accept the status quo and are always looking for ways to make things better
- You’re a lifelong learner who picks up new skills and information quickly
- You’re a highly motivated self-starter who is passionate about creating something meaningful
- You’re based in the greater NYC area

**In addition, it is useful but not essential, if:**

 

You have previous exposure to the construction industry

You have previous experience in a startup environment

**Benefits**

You will learn about all areas of the business and will be expected to contribute in every area, as we all do. Working alongside our founding team, you will have a lot of ownership from day one, and will experience firsthand what it takes to scale up a startup. Benefits include:

 

Competitive salary

Equity - own a part of Disperse, and gain as we grow

Health insurance

23 days’ holiday plus all federal holidays

Friendly, open and transparent culture

Choose your work equipment / devices: your local office will provide you with options to choose from to help you set up the systems and work environment that will keep you happy and productive

Flexible working hours / ability to work from home

Central NYC location (Midtown)

Regular socials, and team retreats to amazing destinations

*Disperse welcomes applications from all sections of society. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other basis as protected by applicable law. If you have a disability or additional need that requires accommodation, please do not hesitate to let us know.*

 

**The process**

The interview process will involve:

 
- An initial 30-minute conversation to get to know you
- 1-hour on-site interview: with members of the business development, product, and project delivery team
- Take home task to understand your problem solving skills and style
- 1-hour on-site interview with teams: presentation of home task with Q&A, followed by technical and personal fit chats with different members of the team
- 1-hour on-site interview with different members of the team
